Part B (i) Use the given data to find the average rate of change of the number of plants, in plants per year, from <math alttext="t equals 2"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> to <math alttext="t equals 8"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></math> years. Express your answer as a decimal approximation. Show the computations that lead to your answer. (ii) Use the average rate of change found in part B (i) to estimate the number of plants for <math alttext="t equals 10"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math> years. Show the work that leads to your answer. (iii) The average rate of change found in part B (i) can be used to estimate the number of plants during year <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math>, for <math alttext="t greater than 10"><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mn>10</mn></math> years.
